item.title: Outbreaks Within Toronto Healthcare Institutions in 2020
item.description: Abstract This is a data analysis of the outbreaks in Toronto health institutions within 2020 using ggplot2 (Wickham (2016)) and tidyverse (Wickham et al. (2019)) within R Markdown (JJ Allaire (2020)). An overview of the paper includes an outbreak distribution seen within healthcare settings which shows majority of reported outbreaks occurring within long-term care homes raising concerns about the infection prevention and control procedures within these facilities. When the dataset was filtered to examine only COVID-19 outbreaks within all institutions, the trend of outbreak occurrence date displays the pattern of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: R Mark Down Code
item.description: Listed below is the R Markdown code for the blog post “Outbreaks Within Toronto Healthcare Insitutions in 2020”. knitr::opts_chunk$set(collapse = TRUE) install.packages("opendatatoronto") install.packages("ggplot2") library(dplyr) Abstract This is a data analysis of the outbreaks in Toronto health institutions within 2020 using ggplot2 (@citeggplot2) and tidyverse (@citetidyverse) within R Markdown (JJ Allaire (2020)). An overview of the paper includes an outbreak distribution seen within healthcare settings which shows majority of reported outbreaks occurring within long-term care homes raising concerns about the infection prevention and control procedures within these facilities.
